content: Total revenues were $41 million in the third quarter of 2022, a decrease of 9% year-over-year, and flat compared to last quarter. Non-GAAP gross margin for the third quarter was 59.8%, which was 5.7% lower than Q3 2021 mainly due to increased revenue from our broadcast streaming product, which contributed approximately 80% of our total revenues in the quarter and at lower gross margin. Non-GAAP sales and marketing expenses were $13 million in Q3 up 17.7% year-over-year, mainly due to team expansion in the US and certain international markets, and increased advertising and event expenses. Non-GAAP operating loss was $18.7 million, translating to a 45.7% non-GAAP operating loss margin fourth quarter, compared to operating loss margin of 24.6% in Q3 last year. Net cash outflow in the quarter was mainly due to free cash flow of negative $9.9 million, prepayment for land use right purchase of $137.4 million, net of deposit refunded cash paid for long-term investments of $3.1 million and share repurchase of $3.1 million.
